intro: Saxifraga exarata var. heldreichii, commonly known as the Balkan saxifrage, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It is characterized by its basal rosette of elliptical, hairy leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers in late spring. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. It is adapted to cold climates and has a low-growing habit to withstand harsh weather conditions. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens.
